page.title: 10FARMING IN DEERNESS (1)
page.content: The land is{arable,}most suited to rearing{beef.}A farmer's work revolves round his herd of beef cows. Since the introduction of{Continental breeds}the fattening time is less so more beasts are kept. Good{winter housing}is necessary. Some farmers favour loose cattle on slats, in courts or cubicles while others still prefer tied byres. Most{calves}are born indoors in Spring when the farmer is also busy cultivating land. With so much grass needed for{grazing, hay and silage only about one tenth is ploughed for {barley and potatoes.}The cooler climate which is free from virus carrying aphids makes favourable conditions for high grade{seed {potatoes.}A small number of{sheep}and {poultry}are kept. Most farms are self sufficient but contractors are available.
